Reviews.Title: “Great and Quaint accomodation in the heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in this quaint hotel which is centrally located in Amsterdam. The staff were wonderful and would help with tickets to museums, tours and resturants. The staff were so friendly that they made everyone feel at home. The rooms were cozy and clean along with a great breakfast. I found I was able to travel with ease to all parts of the city from this location. It is near the Tram line, Dam square, the Canal boat tour, Anne Frank house and many other ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller8989
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel for Easter and it really impressed me. The famous stairs will bring you to the reception where the very helpful (and polite, which you rarely find anywhere nowadays) staff will great you. You will be given brochures with discounts and 'must see' of the city - which I found lovely, so we didn't need to go to the tourist info. A very kind man will bring your luggage up the stairs and will be preparing a lovely breakfast consisting of: croissants, cheese, ham, bread, chocolate muffins, cereals, juices (pure juice not those horrible mixes you usually find) and more. There is also a coffee machine where a good selection of warm drinks (tea, cappuccino, caffe latte) are available. We booked a room of 6 square meters. Space was initially a bit of an issue, but after organising it became quite functional. Fortinure is new and the room is very clean (and the cleaner comes every day). TV seemed new - maybe installed a bit too high. The bathroom was common, very clean must be said. Shower also clean and spacious. Flowers in the bathroom - nice touch. The location is perfect, Dam Square can be reached within four minutes. Basically every top destination from the hotel is within 26 minutes (the farthest being Albert Cuyp market) Top tips: 1. Have breakfast outside, there is a lovely terrace with flowers 2. Book in advance (there are not many rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Thanks!!”
Reviews.Author: lupelatana
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam in a cold evening last February.If you want a modern hotel with elevator 5 minutes from central station it will a bit expensive. Instead we chose Clemens Hotel , very near Anne Frank house . It's not so far from the station , you can also take a bus if you don't want to walk. Breakfast was included and we must say that it was tasty and plentiful.The only problem were the stairs but this is common in Amsterdam . The last night that we stayed there my daughter forgot her glasses. So , the following morning before taking the train we asked the man to look for them. He said he would ask the lady in charge of cleaning the rooms and he advice me to send him an email . I did so , and after a few days he wrote they found the glasses, and asked me for an address to send them back. What a surprise when my relatives received a little box from Amsterdam !! We were travelling around Europe... We feel so much grateful for this service , it was really kind from them answering e-mails , caring , asking for an addresss, paying for posting the box .... I recomend this hotel to my friends , we feel comfortable here, and it is in a good neighbourhood . Ahh, I forgot... it has a nice balcony in the breakfast room that we couldn't enjoy because it was cold at that time but I imagine it would be very nice during summer times . We want to be back very soon . Thanks for all . We want to b

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chiho M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Clemens was really nice, friendly hotel. Staffs are very kind and I really enjoyed my stay in Amsterdam.The hotel is in a good location to go sightseeing in the city(It takes only 7 munites to Dam Square, and 2 munites to the nearest tram station).Breakfast was also nice. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: weekaty
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends (previous review) stayed at the Clemens April 1st-April 4th 2012. From the moment we arrived, the hotel exceeded our expectations. As previous reviews have stated, the stairs leading to reception (also the breakfast room) are remarkably steep. My two friends had massively heavy cases, yet the chap at reception lugged them to the room without even so much as a grumble and offered us a complementary drink when we checked in. I stayed in the spotlessly clean single room which was small but perfect for one and was cleaned every day. It is slightly worn and could do with a lick of paint and some fresh furnishings but it is a budget room so you get what you pay for. The breakfast provided by the hotel (included in the room rate) is plentiful and varied. You do have to share a shower and toilet with others on your floor but these were always free. Probably the biggest asset of the hotel is its location; 5 minutes walk to the Anne Frank Museum and Dam Square, 15 minutes from Central Station, 5 minutes to the Jordaan area and 40 minutes stroll down the canal to Museumplein. On our last evening, one of the people I was travelling with had a medical problem with her ears. Long story short, she was concerned about flying and further damaging her hearing. We went in search of an all night pharmacy with no luck. We returned to the hotel to ask reception to locate one for us. The chap (I'm really sorry we never got your name) went above and beyond. He contacted a doctor and got my friend ear drops and nasal spray to help ease the blockage in her ears. Bearing in mind this was 10pm on a Tuesday night and he provided her with these items free of charge, I think this was remarkable service and deserves attention drawn to it. We are incredibly grateful for his help and caring attitude. All in all, if you want exceptional luxury this isn't the place for you. If you want a central hub for sightseeing, amsterdam charm and service that is pitched perfectly (help when you need it, peace when you don't) then stay here. I certainly will be back. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jessica R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Clemens was not only clean and well kept but it was quaint and charming. Perfect location. Expansive fresh breakfast whilst chatting with the staff was a great way to start the day. Most of all the staff are genuinely hospitable and go above and beyond to make your stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “for job”
Reviews.Author: sdfsdfsf f
Reviews.Content: The price ratio is good. the single room is very small and the bathroom is outside the room (in common). The breakfast is good and abundant The rooms are upstairs and between the entrance and your room there are a lot of steep and narrow stairs (not so confortable in particulary with suitcases) the staff is very friendly the hotel is only 5 minute (foot) from the center (good position)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, the staff is very kind.”
Reviews.Author: OliveiraM1966
Reviews.Content: Very good location, not far from main train station, it is located in an old building complex. Mr. Ahmad and Mrs. Danielle are there to help the guests, they help you out carrying your luggage to your room. Wifi available with no fees. Big screen Tv set in the room with hundred of channels in many languages. Don't expect to tune in your local Tv station, but you can watch movies and news. Due to historic building location, there is no lift in the complex, the stairway is very long and high. Breakfast with a lot of options.

Reviews.Title: “best deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: graeme l
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a little gem, the staff friendly, though the stairs were a bit steep, but that is to be expected as that suits the buildings, the hotel was clean and tidy, breakfast was very good as well, overall a very good hotel to stay at and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clemens Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valentina m
Reviews.Content: We slept in this hotel for 3 nights.We have had a good timeThe Hotel is in the near of the centrum and the staff is very kindly.Acthung only to the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “best deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: turulmadar
Reviews.Content: If you can not handle stairs, this hotel is not for you, but otherwise it is a little gem for the reasonable price you pay, and the service is outstanding. Great location, wonderful breakfast included in price in a cheerful, tasteful breakfast nook, small but clean rooms, and such friendly helpful staff who go out of their way to help you. I had a wonderful stay and would recommend this to those who want a reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: iza333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a prime location very close to the Dam, the staff very nice even if you are stoned: D: D: D room was cleaned daily, clean towels. what else? definitely recommend this hotel to my friends in the future: D -- regards Iza

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for budget travelers guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: saralegnets
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5-night stay at this hotel very much. Our room was a bit small, but regarding the price and the services offered, it was definitely worth it. Just 3 minutes walking from Dam Square, directly neighboring the 9 streets, excellent breakfast, kind and helpful staff. No need to find a hotel fitting our needs better than Hotel Clemens for our next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doris L
Reviews.Content: the location is good and it has very good service. I would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Michael J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel and I would definitely stay here again. Nothing fancy and a small economy room, but I was only looking for a place to sleep at night. The room was clean and comfortable. Only downside was the sound of something like an elevator or other large electronic device running off and on all night, so I wore earplugs. Certainly nothing that would prevent me from staying here again. AND, the breakfast was fabulous, far more than I expected. The staff was also very friendly and helpful, even helping me book a taxi in another city after my train ride. Easy to find, just about a 15 minute walk from the Centraal Train Station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “friendliness, cleanliness and beauty”
Reviews.Author: Rossella V
Reviews.Content: I'm back from a day to amstedram, I stayed in a deluxe double room, the room was beautiful and clean, welcoming and friendly owners are always available, delicious breakfast for everyone, I have always taken the cornetto and cappuccino which was delicious, but there is so much more. we left at night and gave us breakfast bag, without us, we ask, were really good and kind to us, especially because we do not speak English and had to let us know! the location is great, 5mins from dam square and 10 minutes from Central Station. I recommend everybody to go there, I will definitely return. p.s: it is true that the stairs are very steep, but to amsterdam so a bit everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “good quality and price”
Reviews.Author: MIGUEL M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Little familiar hotel with no more than 10 rooms..Good location, behind the Dam square...I staid in the deluxe room it was fine..For the price you pay what do you expect? Very good breakfast, nice and helpful stuff. The only thing was the stairs you have to climb to your room

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: jojaedal
Reviews.Content: I just read the review of thefreefa11 and wish it had been published before I made the mistake of booking. I suffered a similar experience from the receptionist who insisted on cash up front for my 3 night stay. Nowhere was this mentioned on their website or the booking company's website and a subsequent check showed that they accepted all CC's. Being a late Sunday afternoon none of the cash machines in the locality had cash so I offered to pay the following day but he refused and insisted that he had to have full payment by 6.00pm. This immediately rang alarm bells so I asked to see the room which he reluctantly showed me - the very room thefree11 stayed in. It was awful and nothing like those that you see on their website. A slight disagreement followed and I guess he thought he had me over a barrel being late on Sunday with most hotels full. Anyway he demanded full payment in cash there and then or I could leave. Needless to say after a few more heated exchanges I left and found room in the NH City Centre. I thought that was the end of it and enjoyed a very pleasant stay with my wife and daughter. It was only when I returned home that I found out that he had put in a demand for several thousands of pounds on my CC. It was shown as a pending amount and remained on my account for over a week. He had threatened to charge me for one nights stay which I immediately disputed as it was he who was being totally unreasonable and it was he who left me little choice but to leave. I would not have stayed in the place anyway because the whole set-up just looked so unprofessional and I just didn't trust him. I am absolutely staggered at some of the positive reviews and wonder did I enter the wrong door but no it was definitely the Hotel Clemens. What they did was tanatmount to attempted fraud but thankfully they never followed through - clever because neither I or the Bank have the evidence to pursue legally! I doubt whether they actually intended to take such a large sum - just to screw up my credit limit in the hope that I could not use my card in Amsterdam! They failed and I was just thankful that I did not find out until I got home otherwise they would have succeeded in ruining an otherwise pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “shocking arrogant' violent Even french guy/owner is a D!$K head”
Reviews.Author: thefreefa11
Reviews.Content: Dear potential future customers I strongly advice you not wanting to call you that anymore after reading all previous recommendations including mine: I stayed at this hotel with two friends for three nights just after Christmas 2011 and had a trip from hell. On arrival we were greeted by the apparent owner. Without a word of welcome he requested not 1 passport as proof of identity but the passports from all 3 of us.as this is unusual We simply wanted to know why he suddenly needed the passports. He stated that all English are trouble makers and when we pointed out we where Scottish and remained to stay very friendly but he hit the roof and told us we werenâ€™t staying there and he was keeping our first nights money as he had to wait around till half ten for our arrival. When trying to calm him down he became threatening and we had to call hotel runners, through which we booked this hotel. When talking to the very helpful and nice person at hotel runners he kept pointing out that he needed our passports PLUS he was keeping the first dayâ€™s deposit and wanted us out since all English people are trouble Upon repeatedly pointing out that we weren't English but Scottish he went ballistic and became threatening to a point where we felt endangered! We tried to explain that we weren't going to ruin his place not that it was spectacular in any way to start with. he kept on ranting about Englishmen and how they were bad for his business. After continuing to point out that he needed to stop his rant since we werenâ€™t going to demolish anything he threw us out or rather triedâ€¦since on the other line the hotel runner team member managed to calm him down eventually by taking full responsibility for any unlikely damages to the hotel through us. Had he not managed to let us stay at Hotel Clement we would have been stranded in Amsterdam without a hotel, hostel or anywhere to sleep since the city's accommodations were all fully booked (which the hotel runnerâ€™s member had checked first thing). Although the hotel was really uncomfortable and quite the opposite of clean it was better than having to camp in the open! Our first night was very awkward since we felt that we not only shared a room with one another but with the other guests too thanks to the paper thin walls and ceilings but after finally falling asleep, we were woken by a non English speaking cleaner who requested to clean our room. Although she didn't speak English we made clear that any cleaning was not requested and thought that she had understood since she left. After venturing out into the buzzing city we returned to the room - which had been cleaned and our bags had been moved. I believe that it should be clear that if guests do not wish their rooms to be cleaned whilst in the rooms the rented out rooms should stay locked whilst out! After yet another almost sleepless night, thanks to the mentioned wall thickness and nastily mattresses we were really looking forward to a hearty breakfast or at least something edible to kick start the day. Expecting to find the dining room open we found ourselves standing in front of an empty room with all edible things removed. Asking where the food was available until â€¦â€¦.. not sure about the time â€¦â€¦ he told us that we had missed the timeslot and that he wasnâ€™t willing to extend it for people that slept in â€“ not taking into account that the sign behind him pointed out that the buffet was actually still running according to the time. Nevertheless we still had a great time in Amsterdam apart from our hotel. We are all very happy we had only booked three nights at this place and cannot recommend this hotel to anyone unless you want to experience the extremes!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: suziebloo
Reviews.Content: Reception stayed open until after 10pm as I had a late flight arrival. Bedroom compact & bijou. Clean linen, fridge, tv, towels all provided. A kettle would have been nice but Jennifer's across the street happy to serve tea takeaway. Close to all amenities i.e. station, palace, dam square, rembrandtplein, shopping, restaurants, coffee shops, Ann Frank's house & walking distance to the museums. Shared bathroom spotlessly clean & well stocked, as was the shower room. As much as you can eat buffet breakfast. Plenty to dislike - steep, narrow staircase; traffic noise & regular chiming church clock but this added to the Amsterdam atmosphere. If you're looking for a budget break & can cope with a few stairs, this place is for you!

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: this was the cheapest hotel we found, even cheaper than all the hostels we looked at. took us in without prior booking and was much "safer" than the hostel we stayed in the previous night. had an issue with a lost bracelet - was dropped in reception returned within minutes and it had "vanished" forever. only staff member present. was late for breakfast one morning and they let us have some on plates to take too our room which we though was great as they didnt have too. but in general, was very good and the room was lovely. would defo go again.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel ever, outrageous behaviour of the receptionist”
Reviews.Author: dariusz w
Reviews.Content: I have spent 4 nights in this terrible hotel. Wanted to move out after the first night but unfortunately all the nearby hotels were fully booked. I stayed in a single room which is so small there is even hardly any place to fit your luggage on the floor. Dirty bed cover, no towels, no shower gel, dirty shared shower cabin, toilet so small you can use a toilet seat only with difficulties. You canâ€™t pay by card but only in cash and the receptionist gives you the receipt when checking out. There was no wireless internet access at all, I was told they had a virus and lost network access. I could put up with all of this. However, could not stand extremely rude and unhelpful male receptionist. This guy not only has no idea about customer service but becomes very agitated and aggressive if asked basic questions . I sense some clear personality disorders. Avoid this place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “definitly won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: parisi10
Reviews.Content: talk about steep stairs, i never saw something like clemens! but that is passable, as the room are... although we got a triple room and one of the beds had a "crater" in the middle. also one of our covers was definitly unwashed. thats all ok compared with the treatment we got from the male receptionist, all i can say is, why does he work in hospitality if he hates guests??

Reviews.Title: “Did not honour credit card guaranteed reservation”
Reviews.Author: KnaveSharpener
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay in this hotel through Expedia, with two months to spare. The reservation information states quite clearly: "The reservation is confirmed by Clemens Amsterdam. Your reservation is guaranteed with your credit card." Now, three weeks before I am due to depart, they phone me to tell me that they overbooked, and gave the reservation to a six-night booking instead. The best they could offer in recompense was the phone number of a hotel booking service. Unfortunately, I can't review the hotel and its facilities, because I didn't get the chance to see them, but I can at least rate the service. And leave a warning to any other travellers who might want to rely on their hotel honouring a booking misleadingly described as "guaranteed".

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Daz-1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel clemens again for the queensday week during late april/early may & i can honesty say it had everything i needed,,,The staff were friendly & helpful + The room was clean with fresh towels/sheets & plenty of hot water all day long, Also the wi-fi & breakfast are FREE! a rare thing these days,,,Ive never personaly seen anyone smoke weed in the breakfast room in all the 9 years ive been going there! nor have i had anyone being mean or arrogant to me either,,,In my opinion its a great little hotel for the price! its family run & dead centraal to everything as well,,,Ok the stairs can but a bit much if your disabled or elderly but thats about the only down side i can think of while ive stayed there! oh & maybe when other people stink the toilet out before you use it but thats about it all,, If i wanted gold taps & 24 hour room service i would have stayed at the intercontinental or hotel Krasnapolsky :),Only thing is you will be paying 5 star prices also,Overall clemens is a good affordable place to stay if you going solo/with friends or even family.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Kingseleven
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the very steep stairs which weren't a problem as they were expected. All of the staff were brilliant and even had my room upgraded to a double en suite at no extra cost. Rooms were a little dated, but that only added to the charm. The room was vry clean however and again very impressed by the staff. As this is a budget hotel I wasn't expecting a great deal but definitely got more than I bargained for. I enjoyed breakfast on the second day but was too busy on the third. Location was excellent. Overall I was impressed and if I ever return to Amsterdam I will visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok, except for the staff”
Reviews.Author: Frolicking
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is fine if all you want to do is sleep there. The rooms are very small, but comfortable enough. The safe in the room is a plus. The location is good, and from what I could tell, they have very competitive prices. We were lucky that our room looked out onto the courtyard and so it was very quite. A street-side room might be harder to sleep in, as the hotel is on a busy street. However, the staff was less than pleasant. the first day we checked in there was a blond woman working the desk- she was very pleasant and helpful. She was gone the subsequent days that we stayed. The man who lives and works the desk is very unpleasant. All he cared about was smoking pot and watching tv (we could smell pot every time that we walked past the floor with the reception and you could smell it on our floor as well, but the smell was fainter). I personally don't care for any smoke, especially when the fumes travel to your room). The guy was also very rude, and though they claim the breakfast area is open until 11pm, he told us we could not sit there and drink tea because it is open only for breakfast- basically, he had set out the dishes already by noon for the next day and did not feel like doing extra work to clean any cups. For the sake of the hotel, I hope they get a new employee rather quickly, since, if it was not for him, our stay would have been much more pleasant. And of course, they censor any negative comments on their hotel website, so look elsewhere for honest reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: dziewczontko
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Clemens hotel 3 nights in June 2011. Since we travel a lot, we always use a Trip Advisor. We read a lot of good/excellent comments and...we couldn't be more wrong about this place. First of all, when you go to Clemens hotel website, you see nice building from outside and cosy rooms inside. In fact, hotel is only a small part of building we see on picture and rooms are very small and crappy. Steps were very steep but we knew it from previous comments. The "restaurant" (hard to call it since they had only 3 2-person tables) is a room merged with reception. Food was ok - nothing spectacular, more like hostel breakfast. Employees were eating next to customers. We stayed in room with sink - one out of 2 good thing in there. The second was safety box. Service was terrible - besides the check-in (done with a nice blond girl), we didn't hear "good morning" or "hi" - nothing. After early check out (7.30 am) we wanted to wait for breakfast. Then we heard that we have to move ourselves to our room (AFTER CHECK OUT!!!) cause this guy will need a space to bring food. From the good things - towels were changed every day and beds were always one. The location is also very good, however for this amount of money or even less (!!!) I'm pretty sure you will be able to find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Daz-1976
Reviews.Content: Hotel clemens is a great place to stay while in amsterdam,With friends/family or just simply going it alone! personaly ive stayed there 6 times now over the last 9 years & ive never had any problems at all with my stuff or the staff in general,They have always been courteous & polite,There prices have always been affordable also! + the sheets & towels are clean,Breakfast & wifi is also available for those who want it, If your on a budget or just simply wana be near the city centre & nightlife i would say book here! you could do alot worse elsewhere for your money by the time you factor in taxi fares etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ConanvdBergh
Reviews.Content: The Clemens is my favourite hotel in Amsterdam.I've stayed in many other hotels (3 & 4 stars),but this hotel is always my # 1 choice.On arrival I'm always given a friendly greeting,handed the keys to my room & front door.Then I'm free to come and go as I please.A nice continental breakfast is offered in the morning to start the day off : tea,coffee,juice,toast,eggs etc.In my opinion this hotel has all that I need when in Amsterdam,its clean & tidy,quite small but at the same time cozy.Value for money in an expensive European capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bed bug in Hotel Clemens Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Flying-Grasshopper
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs alerts: Stayed 5 nights in the en-suite triple room in Hotel Clemens with my 2 kids during the school half term in Oct 2010. I had a few bite marks after the first night, but my kids did not have any, but they felt itchy all over. We all felt itchy during the whole time in Amsterdam and I had more and more of red spots on the arms and legs. I thought it might be allergy reaction on the skin due to the detergents used on sheets. When we returned home in London, the 3 of us started to have bite mark appearing every day for many days. I counted over 200 bites all over my neck, arms and legs. Fortunately, my kids are not as badly biten. I had to go and see a doctor - it was embarassing. Had to wash all our clothes, steamed our suitcases, and buy bed bugs killer products to spray my house in case the insects hid in the clothes. . Still have bites appearing after 6 days after we returned home. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay at clemens hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tomy2010
Reviews.Content: i want just say thank you for clemens team.they made my stay in amsterdam .just nice hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - unless you like to pay expensive prices for budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LENNi379
Reviews.Content: We turned up on a Saturday and got a room at this hotel. It didn't look too bad and we were quite desperate for a room by the point we found here, as most decent places were fully booked. We were informed that the room was 150 euro for the Saturday and 120 euro for the Sunday but we had to pay cash, as they didn't take credit cards (really?). We left to retrieve our bags and some cash from an ATM, leaving a deposit of 20 euro. When we returned we were given a key each and left to our own devices. Although the guy on reception wasn't rude, he certainly didn't make us feel welcome. On getting to the room - two floors up but this is Amsterdam! - we found it to be reasonably clean (no ground in grime but could definitely do with more that just a flick of a duster but marginally better than some places I've stayed). However, as we moved our beds to be slightly closer to each other, we found used tissues and a toilet roll (unused!) under one bed.....the glass in the window was cracked and the window didn't shut properly. We had NO tea/coffee making facilities in the room itself and reception, where the tea and coffee machine was situated, was shut when we returned from town. Our TV didn't work either, which wasn't a problem for us but may be for other visitors. What was a problem was that reception always seemed to be closed when we returned so even if we wanted to report the problems we couldn't. Breakfast served from 7.30 - 10 am - we missed this on Saturday by not setting our alarm and we had to leave too early for breakfast on Sunday morning. As we handed in our keys for our deposit to be returned, there was absolutely no attempt at communication from the receptionist. No pleasantries such as 'Did you have a nice time?' or 'Have a safe trip home' were offered up - a VERY, VERY poor effort at hostelry in my opinion. On the plus side, our room was at the back of the hotel and, apart from the chiming bells, was pretty good for being able to sleep so close to Dam Square. Beds were ok, too except that the sheets were very ill fitting and poorly put on - I don't pay to make up my own bed!. There was also a bowl of sweets on reception, which we weren't shy at 'helping ourselves to', being as we had paid the best part of Â£300 to stay in this no frills place for two nights and the sweets were the only attempt at a frill in the whole of this place. I would certainly not stay here again unless they dropped the prices drastically. It was a budget hotel at ridiculously high prices. Yes, I know the location is very convenient but, for the price charged, you definitely don't get value for money at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: lottag
Reviews.Content: The service was very friendly and helpful (even when I was in touch with the hotel in advance, and we had trobles with card payment). The staff was flexible and it seemed that they really liked their clients! The room was cousy and little, though not too tiny. The building itself was one of the most beautiful buildings we saw in Amsterdam! Cleaning was very good every day, and happened while we were gone (they didn't come knocking on the door which was superb as I hate it!) The breakfast was very good: enough to choose from and everything tasted good. Location is excellent - it's not situated right in the middle of bars and RDA but just a short walk-distance away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, as I think it suits families etc as well as a grouo of friends or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation in good location.”
Reviews.Author: kiwiguy84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over Easter weekend 2010. Overall I thought that it was a nice place to stay. It is in a very good central location - about 5 minutes walk to Dam Square or to Anne Frank's House. My room was on the top floor and the stairs are VERY steep. Take care on them - especially coming down with a suitcase. The room itself was basic, but had a comfy bed, good tv and a nice balcony with a view out onto the street. The trams can be a bit noisy at first, but you get used to them. The shared shower was in a cupboard off the corridor and the toilet was incredibly small. I consider myself to be a slim person and I could not turn around in there. I had to back myself in and when I closed the door it was up against my knees! The staff were friendly and the breakfast served in the dining room was basic, but good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and fantastic place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: shotenzenjin
Reviews.Content: Amazing service and friendly staff, I can't believe this place is classed as 2 star. I had an awful experience booking a hotel in the red light district inadvertantly and moved here. Clean rooms, kitchly decorated with lots of light, TV, free wireless and phone. The service was brilliant! After my bad experience I insisted on room with an ensuite but they didn't have any single rooms so they gave me a triple room at a single rate - 75 euros. Well worth every penny. Breakfast was continental with lots of variety - too bad however if on low carb diets. The reception area is full of information about things to do, if like me you go without having a clue about amsterdam. I definitely recommend this hotel. xx

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Galvo1
Reviews.Content: After climbing the steep stairs to level one you are greeted by a smiling face at reception. Room was small but had fridge and tv with many channels in English. Very central to all to see and do in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Daz-1976
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the money,Rooms have a safe/fridge/satelite tv/wi-fi & breakfast is free! a rare thing these days,Ive been going to amsterdam for 10 years now & ive stayed at the clemens hotel for the last 8 of them & i wouldnt go anywhere else as i have everything i need right there.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly service and noisy room”
Reviews.Author: balina7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and made a reservation for room number 7. The problem is, the bed was very uncomfortable and the heating or air conditioning was very noisy so we couldn't really sleep. On the day of the departure the staff already came about 15 minuets before leaving time and asked us to leave the room so they could come clean. When we told the manager of the hotel that this is unacceptable since we paid for the room and have the right to stay until last minute, she was very unfriendly and didn't appologize at all. It is a good location but because of the service being so unfriendly I wouldn't recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Old_Gregg_9
Reviews.Content: Pretty good place. There are lots of steep stairs though - not a problem for me but if you don't like stairs then maybe look elsewhere. Breakfast was OK, nothing too flash. Staff were OK although saw one of them go off at another guest for some reason. Room itself was good, although noisy in the morning as it overlooked the street, and a church nearby, but with earplugs, no problems. Also had a balcony with chairs and table. Very good for the money. Shared toilet and shower although right outside the door. 60e for a single, including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: andymclaughlan
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner went out for a weekend to the Clemens, have been 3 times now to the same hotel. Must say, fantasitc rooms, great location and very welcoming staff.. Breakfast is also very good with something for everyone. Would recommend to anyone even the stairs are not that bad worth the climb!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, reasonable for the money”
Reviews.Author: paperfree
Reviews.Content: We chose Clemens hotel because it was cheap, centrally located, and the reviews here on Tripadvisor looked reasonable. Plus they let us book only one night on a weekend, when most hotels in Amsterdam require minimum two nights. We stayed in a triple "deluxe room" that was on the same level as the check-in desk. It cost 150 euros a night for three single beds. It's definitely a budget hotel, but it was reasonable given the price. Pros: + they give you a set of keys so you can come and go as you please + the room and bathroom were clean + the shower had good water pressure + free wireless internet that worked fine + in April, the room was quiet and the temperature was comfortable + room came with extra blankets + the staff greeted us with coffee and/or tea + breakfast was included, and was perfectly fine Cons: - steep, long entry stairway (not a big deal for us, since we're used to stairs) - a dead insect on our mirror (probably they spray the rooms) - room was very small and quite crowded with three twin beds - bathroom was tiny; it was almost impossible to close the door when you were on the toilet - sheets weren't very high quality--slightly stiff and scratchy, although my friends didn't seem to notice and I still slept fine - they only gave us one key, and there's no phone in the room and no one at the desk in the evening, so if one person wants to go home before the others, letting them in can be a problem

Reviews.Title: “Clemens Hotel”
Reviews.Author: damtraveler
Reviews.Content: My flight arrived early, was hoping to drop my bags off when I arrived. It was around 10 am before they answered the phone. Once I made contact with the staff they more than willing to help. The stairs are steep and long, 30 to reach the reception area. Staff was pleasant and always willing to help in anyway The room was a economy single and was much larger than I had envisioned. It was the length of the bed and more than twice as wide. Any one that is looking at a budget Hotel should know that shared toilet and showers are a given. I stayed in room #8 which had a balcony. I do not recommend this property for obese or elderly . Would definitely stay there again. All in all its a good location and the room was clean

Reviews.Title: “Good place for some days”
Reviews.Author: Brenoka
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading about it in a well-known travel guide. First thing I have to comment: if you are that person who scares just thinking of stairs, be very away from this place! Their "welcome-stair" can really take any breath away. But if you remember you're in Amsterdam, where probably 99% of the buildings don't have lifts, that will be ok! Now, let's point the facts: this hotel has a great location, easily reached by tram from any place you are. You can even walk directly from main train station (about 15 to 20 minutes on foot). Anne Frank's house stands no more than 5 minutes from there. Staff were friendly. We were given some maps and a kind of cultural agenda, showing several events that would take place in Amsterdam along the week ahead. Rooms are good, confortable and everyday cleant. Our room was equipped with fridge and strongbox. Breakfast is excellent. In my opinion this is a good place where money really values!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlgrlNY
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Hotel Clemens because it was clean, cheap, had a delicious breakfast and is in a great location. The staff was helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Clemens”
Reviews.Author: CloudlessBlueSky
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel may have recently changed ownership because their website seems to be written by a woman named Dee. Our very negative experience with the Clemens Hotel was with a male owner who refused to tell us his name when I asked! We booked this hotel for 2 nights after the review in the Rough Guide called it "excellent." I would say this is not at all the case anymore. We had some problems with the room and tried to talk to this man who said he was the owner and he was incredibly rude, unhelpful, and disrespectful to us. Alarmed by his reaction to our request for a change of room, we asked to get our money back for the second night of our stay, which he promptly refused. In a second incident, on the last morning we were there we had another terribly unpleasant encounter with this same man. The hotel's website says all over the place that breakfast is served until 10:30. We came downstairs at 10:15 and he said breakfast ended at 10 and he refused to even give us a cup for the coffee machine that was still sitting out. He sarcastically asked if we thought that he was supposed to come up and wake us up in time for breakfast. When we said we would just check out then he followed us to the door shaking his keys at us in an extremely bizarre manner. His behavior seemed very threatening and perhaps mentally unstable. I can see no other explanation for a hotel owner to treat customers in this way. I would strongly NOT recommend the Clemens Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Queen's Day”
Reviews.Author: reilly850
Reviews.Content: When we booked, we didn't know anything about Queen's Day. We were there the day before Queen's Day until the day after Remembrance of the Dead (like Memorial Day in the U.S.) We were so close to all the action. The night before Queen's Day there is lots of partying, and it seemed especially gregarious by the Homomonument, which is quite close to the Hotel Clemens and the Anne Frank house. Our room, #7, was on the top floor overlooking the main street. The room was quite small, but clean. The bathroom was clean. We had no problem with anything going missing. The main staff member, a young man, was very helpful, and took our bags from the front door up the 37 stairs to reception. He may even have taken them up the next two flights to our floor. I just can't remember now. We were told when we made the reservation that they wanted full payment in cash (Euros) upon checking in. The stairs are not very wide so if you have any balance problem or vertigo, this is not the place for you. In fact, most of the old hotels are like that. We rented the laptop, and it worked nicely, with their wireless internet. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a cute room”
Reviews.Author: Odalie
Reviews.Content: I came from Paris to Amsterdam for a few days. It meant a lot to me to be in a hotel where I would feel very comfortable, kind of like 'at home', and to be in a very central location. My budget on that trip being somewhat tight, I chose hotel Clemens after browsing several hotel websites on the net. Well I was not disapointed. I got the room I asked for, which turned out to be exactly like on the web (it's not always the case): small,but who cares? I spent most of my time outdoor; actually, I thought it added some charm to it. Very quiet (room on the back, not overlooking the main street), very clean. The staff was very friendly. I appreciated being able to have a cup of tea or coffee any time. As for the steep stairs, to me it's part of these old Dutch houses. This is A'dam! If people are turned off by those stairs, they must then travel in standard hotels which offers the same rooms all over the world! This is not my idea of travelling...

Reviews.Title: “Even my girlfriend was satisfied”
Reviews.Author: steve-the-tap
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel before my girlfriend read the reviews on here. (I didn't know of the site). Some reviews have been very critical but we both thought the hotel was lovely. Good room (double deluxe), friendly reception and ample breakfast. The stairs are definitely breath taking! Great location close to Dam Square & lots of bars & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “NO! NO! NO!”
Reviews.Author: JamesRushby
Reviews.Content: I really wished I had read these reviews BEFORE I booked with the clemens hotel! Like previous reviewers have said it looks at least on its website like a great place to stay - not cheap - but centrally located and friendly, looks can be deceiving! The rooms here are incredably small. OK we booked in a "budget room" (this basically meant shared bathroom), but got outsize coffin. And the room wasnt even cheap, I dont think 75 euro is good value and we have travelled all over europe. The shared shower and toilet are also VERY small, sitting on the toilet I struggled to close the door as my knees were in the way. The shower room you step straight in to the shower basin from the corridor so have to dress and undress stood in the shower. The staff to be fair WERE (see later) nice and friendly and spoke english and offered directions. The breakfast (had to pay more!) was a bit lacking and could get a lot more quantity and quality nearby. Hotel was very central, 5 mins from dam square and near tourist attractions such as cathedral and anne frank house and pretty canals. All would of been fine but for second to last night - THEFT! we returned to room and found things missing. Nothing of dramatic value but stuff that could of easily not have been missed or you would think you had lost it. But I knew that things were in certain places when I left the room on the morning and they were not there on the evening. We informed the management who in time became very unfriendly and basically accused us of lying. I am not a lier, I am a registered nurse, I am an angel! The cleaner (obviously main suspect) gave me evil looks. We made a police report and eventually they refunded cost of stolen items but didnt admit anything and held to the idea that we had lost things. Not that easy to lose things in a room about 8 foot by 6 foot! Basically DO NOT stay there, you will not find cheap accommodation in amsterdam, its a place you need to spend more and youll enjoy it, its a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mrgnk
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the steps up are very very steep and narrow, and a lot of them ( 37 to the reception, and another 20 to the first floor ! ), so you better be travelling light. The room was pretty good, and clean. The view out of the room ( no. 3 ) was great, right on the main road looking out to the palace. But that also meant it was extremely noisy, pretty much all through the day and night. So light sleepers, beware. And the bathroom had the wierdest shower ever. No shower head, just a spout from which water dribbled down. Not a very pleasant bathing experience. The breakfast was the normal European fare, and the management pretty knowledgable about the city and helpful. And the location is great, maybe a 10 minute walk from Dam Square. But for me, the noise, and the steps were enough to put me off another stay here. I would look for another place as and when I do come back to Amsterdam And I loved the city and would certainly love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Crime Scene Investigation”
Reviews.Author: Zvonieka
Reviews.Content: "Who slept on this bed last night?", I asked myself as I decided to open my bed. I found hair on the pillows and decided to send it to trace. By the shape on the sheets, it was clear to see that the last victims were also a couple. That was when we decided to run away. All hotels were fully booked, so we had to spend here one mistery night. Who made these holes on the bed cover? Who tampered with the shower? And finally: who hate all of the bloody croissants in the morning? These questions are still unanswered... maybe for the best. The Clemens seemed a nice place to stay. The pictures showed cosy rooms. But the stains are invisible on the nice photos. Watch out, people... Other crimes may occur. Be afraid... be very afraid...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Clemens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our room at the Clemens Hotel. We stayed in a delux room rather than budget, because the budget rooms were all booked. We were in room 9, which i believe is the only room on the first floor, which was nice because we only had to climb one flight of stairs. Our room was clean and we loved the decor. the bathroom was small, which is to be expected in almost any Eurpoean hotel. We also had a nice view into a courtyard. Breakfast was included in the price and was very nice. The breakfast room was really cute too. The location was also very central, so it only took a few minutes to get to our destinations. We loved our visit and would stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly Clemens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: location EXCELLENT room SPOTLESS stairs INTERESTING! breakfast GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY service EXCELLANT atmosphere VERY FRIENDLY, COSY we walked everywhere, and following the advice of the helpful woman in reception, certainly saw more of this city than your average tourist. will certainly return to this hotel & have recommended it to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: hmeah
Reviews.Content: went there with 5 friends other friends, 3 to a room, when i walked into room 2, put the lights on there were 4 flys spinning around... then i opened the bathroom door only to be greeted by this terrible smell, i asked the lady for fly spray & some freshen for the bathroom.. i asked her to go into the bathroom to check the smell but she refused to & said we should be okay if left open for 5 mins & we'd get use to the smell. the bed covers were stained & the safe did not work. its was nothing like it said it was on the website, when we booked we were told breakfast was included... but when we got there... no breakfast... we paid 300 euros for both rooms, we could have easily got a 4 star hotel for that price... also there was a horrible cat chasing mice all night... shall i start about the stairs.... take your own stair master!!!!! i would never go back there, its been 3 days since getting back & i have bites & have been itching since... i blame my friend porkie as he is use to living in a pig sty. the only good thing about the hotel was the dutch milk/cream you get in reception area...

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. There are many other options in Amsterdam for $10 more than are far superior (we stayed in one of them - The Waterfront). Claustrophobic is the word I would use to describe this narrow row house - 73 steep stairs to our room which was tiny and unattractive. Breakfast is not included; if you add in breakfast for 2 ($14), it brings this hotel into the same price range as other much more desirable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Would I recommend the Clemens?”
Reviews.Author: LegaleagleWorksop
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive comments about this hotel we decided to give it a go for a short, 2 night break. Am I glad that it was only two nights! When you open the front door you are confronted with a monumental flight of stairs that are so steep a ladder would have been easier to climb in comparison. There is no reception area to speak of, just a wooden desk with a computer and phone. Our room, no 7, was toted as being the best in the hotel having a balcony. It was two further flights of stairs up and was dark and dingy. The antique furniture consisted of a battered old table and the balcony doors blew open several times during the night, the balcony itself being covered with old cigarette butts. There wasn't even a wardrobe to hang our clothes. On the plus points the sheets on the bed were clean as was the bathroom although we were pleased not to have to share the inadequate showers and toilet facilities that the other guests had to endure. The staff were curteous. The breakfast was average but not worth the â‚¬7 charged per person. The location was very convenient to all attractions, within walking distance of many. It was also very expensive for a budget hotel, we've paid less for 5 star accomodation in New York! Would we stay there again? Not for all the tea in China. Only to be stayed in as a last resort but useful if you are in training to climb Everest.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 mins walk from central station (two minutes from Dam square) just behind Dam square, so it's very convienient. Our deluxe room was comfortable and adequate, the breakfast bar had a good choice of food and drink (the coffee is instant but good quality and there is a very good choice of teas). Once a week you can hear carrilion concerts from the Westerkerk close by. A couple of rooms have a balcony and they are worth trying to get. We found all the staff friendly and they quickly responded to our modest requests. a light bulb went out in the shower and was replaced as soon as we reported it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and would recommend the hotel. The staff was very helpful and nice and made you feel welcome. The hotel is very close to the Anne Frank house (a must see) and the canals. A local market is a couple of blocks down and restaurants are everywhere. Within walking distance of the Square and, if you want, the Red Light District is about a 20 minute walk away. The tram stop is down the street, but, the train station is within walking distance. The deluxe rooms are nice (but small) and have private showers and toilets. However, the budget rooms are nice also. Beware of the VERY steep stairs. All in all, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are small. Our balcony room had a safe in the closet that made it impossible to hang a coat. However, since one spends little time in the room when one has a city like Amsterdam to explore, it was adequate. The breakfast is not worth 7 Euros. A short walk gives you several choices for better choices with outdoor seating on a canal. No major complaints, but we'll make another choice for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clemens is just 'okay'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the overwhelming positive reviews found here. Although I wouldn't go as far as saying 'Don't stay here' as the previous person did, I was a little disappointed. The bed was hard and uncomfortable, the pillows were very lumpy and it did not appear that any vacuuming was done while we were there. The bathroom was clean and we did get clean towels each day but the shower head was taped into a strange position. Also, the street noise was quite bad and no one mentioned this (or I would have asked about a garden room). Our experience with the staff was positive. No complaints there.If you are on a budget, this hotel is OK and in a good location. If you've got a bit more money, I'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. Worst service ever. Very rude staff who tried to fix my broken shower with some cellotape but did not work! They didn't clean the toilet or much else in the room on any day. "Deluxe room" was very basic. Lumpy bed with hard pillows. You have been warned !

Reviews.Title: “wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wonderful 3* hotel.Dee{the owner}and moustaffa could not do enough for you .Very kind and helpful and very knowledgable about where and what to see and do in this very vibrant and beautiful city. close to nearly everything you would want to see, either by tram or a trip on the canals.Located on Ruidstratt close to Westerkirk and a stone throw from Anne Franks house. A walk down the street takes you to Dam Square and then on to the Red Light District which is a must see. If interested a visit to the famous coffee shops for your wacke bacce or a piece of cake with your coffee. A place where my wife and i hope to return to again.

Reviews.Title: “A totally delightful hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have used the Clemens twice so far on layovers enroute to India on Business and been totally delighted. Very high speed Internet connection is provided in all rooms for free -- in fact, I was able to remote access my PC in the US and watch local TV in the US through the link. If you forgot your PC, they have portables available. Although Rick Steve's have not discovered this hotel, he should. Within 30 minutes of collecting my luggage at Amsterdam airport, I am dropping my bags off at the hotel (using public transit only!) and ready to enjoy Amsterdam, Dee was extremely helpful in planning my day when I needed assistance. Excellent (not the heavy UK style) breakfast buffet with a small but very friendly/almost family staff. Although not a B&B, it approaches it BUT with extreme closeness to Anne Frank's House, the West Church and the downtown area. One very unusual item is the old fashion dutch style of cleaniness. There is no masking of smells with scents or airfreshners -- and the hotel appears to be a very friendly place for those suffering from Multiple Chemical Sensitivity or allergies. Lots of good ethnic resturants within 2 blocks. Being a small established, located in a heritage building that is around 150 yrs old - you can get the feel of yesteryear. For example, no fitness center -- but you will keep fit with the "built in step-machine" known as old Amsterdam stair cases. No elevator - so not for the handicap. The entire hotel appear to be have been completely renovated in the last 2-3 years, so everything is perfect with no wear and tear. I'm looking forward to continued layovers in Amsterdam at the Clemens for the many more business trips that I expect this year. It has been perfect for my needs. I am exploring cities in Amsterdam from here (den Haage, Delft, Haarlem) since the train station is approx a 8 minute walk away -- so after breakfast, I can go exploring and be in another city by 10am and then return in the evening to my base of operations. It is one H*ll of a pleasant experience -- totally exceeded my expection. Ken (semi-retired Microsoftee)

Reviews.Title: “the most romantic hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first weekend away with my girlfriend...The Clemens was the best choice i could have made!! We got the greatest room on the topfloor, one of the deluxe rooms, and deluxe it was! They call themselves a budget hotel, but we discovered nothing "budget"! There was a tv, internet( even laptops!), hairdryer, a romantic balcony with great view, a safebox..we got free tea at the reception all the time and the breakfast was awesome! VERY MUCH RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last April took my 2 teenage daughters to AMsterdam & stayed at the Clemens Hotel. The owner Dee was most helpfull with advice on unusual outings for us, in particular the picnic she helped us plan in the countryside, (we rented bicycles & took the train to Zaandijk) was the highlight of our trip! The rooms are spacious, offering all amenities, we were also able to rent a laptop from reception...thus saving on telephone calls home. Would highly recommend this hotel, we felt very safe (3 females travelling alone)indeed, we felt very much at home. the breakfast balcony is a great relaxing venue at the end of a long day!

HotelInfo.Name: Clemens Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 39, Amsterdam 1016 DC, The Netherlands
